ernest
Interface IErnest

All Known Implementing Classes:
Ernest
public interface IErnest

The interface through which the environment can use an Ernest agent.

Author:
ogeorgeon

Method Detail

setParameters

void setParameters(int regularityThreshold,
                   int maxSchemaLength)
Set Ernest's fundamental learning parameters. Use null to leave a value unchanged.

Parameters:
regularityThreshold - The Regularity Sensibility Threshold.
maxSchemaLength - The Maximum Schema Length.

setTracer

void setTracer(ITracer tracer)
Initialize the tracer that generates Ernest's activity trace. (The tracer is instantiated by the environment so that the environment can choose the suitable tracer and also use it to trace things)

Parameters:
tracer - The tracer.

internalState

java.lang.String internalState()
Get a description of Ernest's internal state. (This is used to display Ernest's internal state in the environment)

Returns:
A representation of Ernest's internal state

step

java.lang.String step(IEffect effect)
Run Ernest one step.

Parameters:
effect - The effect recieved from the environment.
Returns:
The next primitive schema to enact.

getValue

int getValue(int i,
             int j)
Parameters:
i - x coordinate (0 = left, 2 = right)
j - y coordinate (0 = ahead, 2 = behind)
Returns:
The value in the corresponding place in the environment.

addInteraction

IAct addInteraction(java.lang.String schemaLabel,
                    java.lang.String stimuliLabel,
                    int satisfaction)
Parameters:
schemaLabel - The action label in the environment.
stimuliLabel - The stimuli.
satisfaction - The satisfaction.
Returns:
The created or already existing act.

getPlaceList

java.util.ArrayList<IPlace> getPlaceList()
Returns:
The list of places in Ernest's local space memory.

getCounter

int getCounter()
Returns:
The counter of cognitive cycles.

getUpdateCount

int getUpdateCount()
Returns:
The counter of updates from the spatial system.

getSpatialSimulation

ISpatialMemory getSpatialSimulation()
Returns:
Ernest's spatial memory for display.
